授業目的: This course offers an in-depth introduction to key issues in contemporary Japanese society, defined here as the period following World War II. It explores the demographic and structural dimensions of Japanese society, including social class, gender, and ethnic stratification, while also examining specific topics such as labor conditions, education, family dynamics, immigration and the role of media. Through these analyses, the course aims to equip students with the conceptual tools necessary to understand Japan’s global positioning, critically re-evaluate stereotypical perceptions of Japan, and gain deeper insights into its culture and people.
到達目標: Demonstrate a basic understanding of different interpretations of Japanese culture and society;Understand various social problems in Japan;Demonstrate the ability to work independently and in a self-directed manner through appropriate planning, time management, and completion of course work;Demonstrate an ability to make a positive contribution to small group discussion and activities;With a degree of confidence, begin to critically engage with source material in order to accurately summarize key themes/topics in a presentation format.
